creator: flameeyes@gentoo.org
text:
The attached patches changes libapr and libaprutil so that it uses the right 
LDFLAGS and the right libraries when linking them, so that the resulting 
libraries has the required NEEDED entries in the dynamic section (look at 
readelf -d output), allowing to link correctly when using --as-needed.

HTH,
Diego
This stuff has been properly fixed since 1.0.0.
creator: jorton@redhat.com

text:
Any chance of applying the fixes to the 0.9.x line, or does that mess with
compatibility too much?
creator: vericgar@gentoo.org
